sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VIRTUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS VIA LIVE WEBCAST
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time and Date:  10:00 a.m., Eastern Time, on May 10, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To elect 10 directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To consider and vote upon an advisory proposal to approve executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To consider and vote upon an advisory proposal on the frequency of the executive compensation proposal;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To approve a proposal to adopt Frontiers 2017 Equity Incentive Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To approve a proposal to adopt an amendment to Frontiers Restated Certificate of Incorporation to: (i) effect a reverse stock split of the issued shares of Frontier common stock, at a reverse stock split ratio of not less than 1-for-10 and not more than 1-for-25, and to reduce the total number of shares of common stock that Frontier is authorized to issue from 1,750,000,000 to 175,000,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ratify the selection of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To transact any other business that may properly be brought before the meeting or any adjournment or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record at the close of business on March 13, 2017 are entitled to vote at the meeting or any adjournments or postponements thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is very important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 28, 2017, we mailed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice includes instructions on how to access our Proxy Statement and 2016 Annual Report and vote online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who received a printed copy of our proxy materials may also vote by mail by signing, dating and returning the proxy card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting now will not limit your right to change your vote or participate in the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This years Annual Meeting will be a virtual meeting, which means that you will be able to participate in the Annual Meeting via live webcast by visiting www.virtualshareholdermeeting.com/FTR2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Annual Meeting this year is virtual and being conducted electronically, stockholders will not be able to attend the Annual Meeting in person.

sentences.text: Board Characteristics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that diversity in its many forms, and the breadth of perspective that it brings, enhances the effectiveness of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: orporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to exercising good corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors (other than our CEO) are independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An independent Chairman of the Board with extensive duties
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each standing committee is composed exclusively of independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual elections of all directors (not a staggered Board)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frequent executive sessions of independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority voting for our director elections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines for executive officers and non-management directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Board and committee self-evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A robust clawback policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a year that was both transformational and challenging for Frontier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On April 1, 2016, we completed the acquisition of Verizons wireline properties in California, Texas and Florida for a purchase price of $10.54 billion in cash and assumed debt, which allows us to provide services to residential, commercial and wholesale customers in those areas (the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past three years, and culminating with the close of the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition, we have more than doubled in size and scale, improved the quality of our assets, substantially diversified our revenue streams and geographic footprint, and expanded the sophistication and attractiveness of our product offerings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition, we implemented a new customer-focused organizational structure in December 2016, which is designed to improve he customer experience, streamline processes and reduce costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this new organizational structure, we realigned into wo groups: consumer sales and commercial sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows us to better serve the different needs of consumer and business customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-customer facing functions such as finance, human resources, marketing, engineering, information technology and communications that had been regionalized were integrated and centralized to support both segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This eliminated organizational layers, duplicative roles and costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier Communications Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we paid $493 million in common stock dividends and $214 million in preferred stock dividends, while continuing to invest in the expansion and upgrade of our network and product offerings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, R. Perley McBride became our Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McBride has more than 20 years of experience in financial roles in the communications industry, including more than a decade at Frontier earlier in his career.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Frontier also faced challenges that negatively impacted revenue and profitability in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our stock price declined significantly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite these challenges, our Board of Directors believes in the future of Frontier as a provider of quality communications services and has utmost confidence in Frontiers management and its ability to rebuild stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reverse Stock Split and Authorized Share Count Reduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a resolution approving an amendment to our Restated Certificate of Incorporation and is recommending that our stockholders adopt such amendment to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) effect a reverse stock split of the issued shares of Frontier common stock at a reverse stock split ratio of not less than 1-for-10 and not more than 1-for-25 (the exact reverse stock split ratio to be determined by the Board of Directors), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) reduce the total number of shares of Frontier common stock that Frontier is authorized to issue from 1,750,000,000 to 175,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The main reasons for proposing the reverse stock split are to increase the trading price for Frontier common stock and to attract a broader investor base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about this proposal, see page 67.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee sets executive compensation each year based upon the following philosophy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establish clear alignment between the interests of our executives and those of our stockholders by rewarding performance measured by key financial metrics, strategic objectives and relative total stockholder return, and through the use of equity awards, rather than cash, as a significant component of annual compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reinforce our performance culture for our Named Executive Officers (NEOs) by making a majority of their compensation at risk, i.e., contingent upon achievement of specified company and individual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hire and retain talented executives by having a compensation program that is competitive in relation to comparable companies based on size, overall complexity and the nature of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensure company goals are fully aligned throughout the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, we establish company-wide goals to achieve Frontiers business plan for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are compensated to the extent they are successful in leading Frontier to achieve these goals for each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n light of the challenges we faced in 2016 and the resulting decline in the price of our common stock, Frontier paid no annual ash bonuses for 2016 performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in past years, the Compensation Committee elected to grant executives restricted stock awards and performance share awards (but not as replacement for the annual cash bonus), which tie the interests of our executives and our stockholders because the value of these awards will depend on Frontiers common stock price when the ested and earned shares are sold by such executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 93.7% of the votes cast on our 2016 Say-On-Pay proposal were in favor of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about our executive compensation practices, see our Compensation Discussion and Analysis on page 26.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier believes that our compensation program is a sound reflection of our compensation philosophy and, as such, our Board recommends that stockholders vote FOR our 2017 Say-On-Pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive these proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is being furnished to you in connection with the Boards solicitation of proxies to be voted at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, which is being held on May 10, 2017, at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Time, via the internet at www.virtualshareholdermeeting.com/FTR2017, and at any adjournments thereof (the Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is included in our proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy materials, which are available on the Investor Relations page of our website, www.frontier.com, include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Proxy Statement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received printed versions of these materials by mail (rather than through electronic delivery), these materials also included a proxy card or voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information on our website is not incorporated herein by reference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How is Frontier distributing proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under rules adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC), we have elected to furnish the proxy materials to many of our stockholders via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 28, 2017, we began mailing to holders of our common stock (other than those who previously requested electronic or paper delivery) a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received the Notice, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials in the mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Notice instructs you on how to access and review all of the important information contained in the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also instructs you on how you may submit your proxy via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who do not receive the Notice will continue to receive either a paper or electronic copy of our Proxy Statement and 2016 Annual Report, which will be sent on or about March 29, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice by mail and would like to receive a copy of our proxy materials, follow the instructions (contained in the Notice) regarding how you may request to receive your materials electronically or in printed form on a one-time or ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to receive all future proxy materials electronically to help us save printing costs and postage fees, as well as natural resources in producing and distributing these materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to receive these materials electronically next year, please follow the instructions on the proxy card or on the Investor Relations page of our website, www.frontier.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests for printed copies of the proxy materials can be made via the Internet at www.proxyvote.com, by telephone at 1-800- 579-1639 (or, for callers without touch-tone phones, 1-866-232-3037) or by email at sendmaterial@proxyvote.com by sending a blank email with your control number (the 12 digit identifying number in the box on the Notice) in the subject line.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What matters will be voted on at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following matters are scheduled for vote by stockholders at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5    Approve the Amendment to Frontiers Restated Certificate of Incorporation to effect the reverse stock split and a reduction of the authorized number of shares of common stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who can vote at our Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote your shares of common stock at our Annual Meeting if you were a stockholder at the close of business on March 13, 2017, the record date for our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 13, 2017, there were 1,177,978,011 shares of common stock outstanding, with each share entitled to one vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I participate in the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may participate in the Annual Meeting virtually via the internet at www.virtualshareholdermeeting.com/FTR2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to vote or submit a question during the meeting, you will need to follow the instructions posted at www.virtualshareholdermeeting.com/FTR2017 and will need the control number provided on your Notice, proxy card or voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadridge Financial Solutions is hosting our virtual annual meeting and, on the date of the Annual Meeting, will be available via telephone at 1-855-449-0991 to answer your questions regarding how to participate in the Annual Meeting virtually via the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the quorum requirement for our Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of a majority of the outstanding shares of common stock entitled to vote must be present or represented by proxy in order for action to be taken at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes are treated as present for quorum purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change my mind after I have voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can revoke your proxy at any time before the Annual Meeting by giving written notice of revocation to our Secretary, at our address stated on the cover page of this Proxy Statement, by executing and delivering a later-dated proxy, either in writing, by telephone or via the Internet, or by participating in the Annual Meeting and voting virtually via the internet at www.virtualshareholdermeeting.com/FTR2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation in the Annual Meeting will not alone constitute revocation of a proxy.

sentences.text: Do I hold my shares as a registered stockholder or in street name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares of common stock are owned directly in your name, as shown in the records of our transfer agent, Computershare Investor Services, you are considered a registered holder of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares of common stock are held by a broker, bank or other nominee, you hold those shares in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your broker, bank or other nominee will vote your shares as you direct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I hold my shares in street name, does my broker need instructions in order to vote my shares?

sentences.text: If you hold shares of common stock in street name and you do not submit specific voting instructions to your broker, bank or other nominee, how your shares may be voted will depend on the type of proposal.

sentences.text: What is Householding?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a procedure approved by the SEC called householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this procedure, stockholders of record who have the same address and last name will receive only one copy of our Proxy Statement and Annual Report unless one or more of these stockholders notifies us that they wish to continue receiving individual copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure will reduce our printing costs and postage fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who participate in householding will continue to receive separate proxy cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding will not in any way affect dividend check mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, requires our directors and officers, and persons who beneficially own more than 10% of our common stock, to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such directors, officers and greater than 10% stockholders are also required to furnish us with copies of all such filed reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely upon a review of the copies of such reports furnished to us, or representations that no reports were required, we believe that during the year ended December 31, 2016, all persons subject to the reporting requirements of Section 16(a) filed the required reports on a timely basis.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is elected at the annual stockholder meeting to hold office until the next annual stockholder meeting or until his or her successor has been elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are elected by a majority of the votes of the holders of shares of common stock present in person or represented by proxy at the meeting and entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any of the Boards nominees becomes unavailable prior to the Annual Meeting to serve as a director, the Board may select a replacement nominee or reduce the number of directors to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy holders will vote the shares for which they serve as proxy for any replacement candidate nominated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee evaluates and recommends to the Board candidates for nomination to the Board in accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines and membership guidelines adopted by our Board described under Director Qualifications, below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may propose director candidates for consideration by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such recommendation should include the nominees name and qualifications for membership on the Board and should be directed to our Secretary at the address of our principal executive offices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To nominate an individual for election at an annual stockholder meeting, the stockholder must give timely notice to our Secretary in accordance with our bylaws, which, in general, require that notice be received by our Secretary not less than 90 days nor more than 120 days before the anniversary date of the immediately prior annual stockholders meeting, unless the annual meeting is moved by more than 30 days before or after the anniversary of the prior years annual meeting, in which case the notice must be received not less than a reasonable time, as determined by our Board, prior to the printing and mailing of proxy materials for the applicable annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice should include a description of the qualifications of the suggested nominee and any information that is required by the regulations of the SEC concerning the suggested nominee and his or her direct or indirect securities holdings or other interests in Frontier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Proposals by Stockholders for the deadline for nominating persons for election as directors for the 2018 annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decisions regarding the renomination of directors are made by the Board, upon the recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, which annually evaluates each directors performance and contribution to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines, a non-employee director will not ordinarily be renominated if he or she has served on the Board for 15 years, but the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may recommend to the Board for renomination a director regardless of the length of his or her service if, in the judgment of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, such renomination is in the best interests of Frontier and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each candidate for nomination as a director, including each person recommended by stockholders, is evaluated in accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines and additional guidelines adopted by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The additional guidelines set forth specific characteristics that each nominee must possess, set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A reputation for integrity, honesty, fairness, responsibility, good judgment and high ethical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broad experience at a senior, policy-making level in business, government, education, technology or public interes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ability to provide insights and practical wisdom based on the nominees experience and expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An understanding of a basic financial statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comprehension of the role of a public company director, particularly the fiduciary obligation owed to Frontier and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commitment to understanding Frontier and its industry and to spending the time necessary to function effectively as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An absence of a conflict of interest (or appearance of a conflict of interest) that will impair the nominees ability to fulfill his or her responsibilities as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier Communications Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the additional guidelines, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee also evaluates whether the background and qualifications of the directors, as a group, is diverse, and whether each individual nominee possesses a depth of experience, knowledge and ability that will enable him or her to assist the other directors in fulfilling the Boards responsibilities to Frontier and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee must also be willing to commit that he or she will comply with our director stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee utilized a third party facilitator to assist with the evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a nominee should be independent, as defined by the SEC and the Nasdaq Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by applicable law and our bylaws, nominees who do not qualify as independent may be nominated when, in the opinion of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, such action is in the best interests of Frontier and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we do not have a formal policy regarding Board diversity, when evaluating candidates for nomination as a director, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee does consider diversity in its many forms, including among others, experience, skills, ethnicity, race and gender.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe a diverse Board, as so defined, provides for different points of view and robust debate and enhances the effectiveness of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, the Board includes one or more current and/or former CEOs, CFOs, investment bankers, experts in communications, marketing and strategy, auditors and individuals of different race, gender, ethnicity and background.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, 10 nominees are to be elected and each will hold office until the next annual stockholder meeting or until his or her successor has been elected and qualified.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier uses cash and stock-based compensation to attract and retain qualified non-employee members of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCarthy, the only employee director, receives no remuneration for service as a member of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Retainer and Stipend  Paid in Cash or Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is paid an annual $95,000 retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2016, the Lead Director and committee chairs were each paid a stipend ($25,000 for Lead Director, $25,000 for the Audit Committee, $20,000 for the Compensation Committee, $15,000 for the Retirement Plan Committee and $15,000 for the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective April 1, 2016, we eliminated the position of Lead Director and established the position of independent Chairman of the Board, who is paid an additional annual stipend of $175,000, 45% in cash and 55% in stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may elect, by December 31 of the prior year, whether to receive the retainer and stipend, if any, in stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are also entitled to reimbursement for reasonable expenses they incur in connection with Board meetings they attend in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual retainer (in cash or stock units) is payable in advance in equal quarterly installments on the first business day of each quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stipends (in cash or stock units) are payable in arrears in equal quarterly installments on the last business day of each quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Fee  Paid in Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors receive additional compensation in the form of stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each non-employee director received a $120,000 fee in the form of stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock units for fees are earned quarterly and credited to the directors account on the last business day of the quarter in which the fees are earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of stock units credited equals the amount of the retainer, stipend or fee (as appropriate) divided by the closing price of our common stock on the credit date of the stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hold all stock units until a directors termination of service, at which time the units are redeemable, at the directors election, in either cash or in shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table sets forth compensation information earned for 2016 by each non-employee director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name    Director Compensation Paid in Cash ($)     Stock Unit Awards ($  value)      Total ($)   Leroy T. Barnes, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) The amounts shown in this column represent the grant date fair value in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board ASC Topic 718 of the stock units granted to directors in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of valuation assumptions, see Note 11 to the Consolidated Financial Statements included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends are paid on stock units held by directors at the same rate and at the same time as we pay dividends on shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No above-market or preferential dividends were paid with respect to any stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends on stock units are paid in the form of additional stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain corporate governance policies and practices that reflect what the Board believes provide appropriate oversight, leadership and independence as well as those required by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and the rules of the SEC and the Nasdaq Stock Market (Nasdaq), on which our common stock is listed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our Corporate Governance Guidelines is available upon request to our Secretary, or may be viewed or downloaded from the Investor Relations page of our website, www.frontier.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On April 1, 2016, Pamela D.A. Reeve became our independent, non-executive Chairman of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reeve had previously held the position of Lead Director and has been an independent member of our Board since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that it would be in the best interests of our stockholders at this time to separate the role of CEO and Chairman given the recent completion of our CEO succession plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will continue to evaluate our leadership structure based on the best interests of Frontier and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Chairman:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Call meetings of the Board and non-management directors (including those to be attended only by independent directors) when appropriate and preside at such meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following each executive session, the Chairman will discus with the CEO any issues arising in such executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coordinate the flow of information to and among independent directors and, if any, other non-management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Collaborate with the CEO to set Board meeting agendas and review and approve Board meeting schedules to ensure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Board members are encouraged to communicate to the Chairman any additional agenda items that they deem necessary or appropriate in carrying out their duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Periodically solicit from other independent and non-management directors comments or suggestions related to Board operations, including the flow of information to directors, the setting of meeting agendas and the establishment of the schedule of Board meetings, and communicate those suggestions to the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman shall also seek to ensure that there is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) an efficient and adequate flow of information to the independent and non-management directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) adequate time for the independent and non-management directors to consider all matters presented to them for action; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) appropriate attention paid to all matters subject to oversight and actions by the independent and non- management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attend all committee meetings, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman shall work with each committee chair to ensure that each committee is effectively functioning and providing ongoing reports to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serve as the liaison between the independent and non-management directors, on the one hand, and the CEO, on the other, and as the representative of the independent and non-management directors in communications with the CEO and management outside of regular Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serve as liaison and provide direction to advisers and consultants retained by the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board does not have a policy as to whether the roles of Chairman and CEO should be separate or combined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the roles are combined, the Board will also have a Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee annually reviews our leadership structure to determine whether the existing structure is in the best interests of Frontier and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer Succession
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is actively engaged in managing executive talent and succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews and considers succession development plans for the CEO and the development of executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of Frontiers succession plan for the CEO in connection with its annual assessment of the performance of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is required to affirmatively determine that a majority of the directors qualify as independent under Nasdaq listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board undertakes an annual review of director independence by reviewing relationships between Frontier and each director as well as Frontier and the organizations with which each director is affiliated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the relevant facts, the Board has determined that no director, other than Mr. McCarthy, has a material relationship with Frontier (either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with Frontier) that would impair the directors ability to exercise independent judgment in carrying out his or her responsibilities as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, all of our directors, other than Mr. McCarthy, are independent under Nasdaq listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Shapiro, who serves on our Retirement Plan Committee, is the Co-President of WME/IMG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Frontier engaged WME/IMG to assist in the negotiation and entry into certain sponsorship and content arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board reviewed this business relationship and determined that the value of the engagement is immaterial to WME/IMG given WME/IMGs gross revenues and that Mr. Shapiros independence is not impaired
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Board has determined that 9 of our 10 director nominees are independe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management and Board Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for oversight of Frontiers risk management process, and the full Board regularly discusses exposure to various potentially material risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Audit Committee also reviews risk exposures and the guidelines and policies governing managements assessment and management of exposure to risk, including the enterprise risk management (ERM) process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for Frontiers risk management activities, including the annual ERM process, which is jointly administered by the Chief Financial Officer and the Senior Vice President, Internal Audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the ERM process, each member of senior management and his or her direct reports participate in an annual identification, assessment and evaluation of risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The individual risks are aggregated across Frontier to help management determine our enterprise level risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each such risk, one or more mitigation strategies are developed and implemented to minimize or manage that risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the course of the year, periodic monitoring, self-assessment and reporting to the Audit Committee are performed by senior management to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Update the trending of each risk, compared to the latest annual ERM review;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identify/consider new and emerging risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assess the implementation status/effectiveness of each mitigation strategy; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identify changes to mitigation strategies, if necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board held 8 meetings and committees of the Board held a total of 24 meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average attendance at these meetings exceeded 98% and each director attended at least 90% of the aggregate number of meetings of the Board and those committees on which he or she served during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our policy, all members of the Board attended last years annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (the Code of Conduct) to which all employees, executive officers and directors (which for purposes of the Code of Conduct we collectively refer to as employees) are required to adhere in addressing the legal and ethical issues encountered in conducting their work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct requires that all employees avoid conflicts of interest, comply with all laws and other legal requirements, conduct business in an honest and ethical manner, and otherwise act with integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are required to report any conduct that they believe is an actual or apparent violation of the Code of Conduct and may do so anonymously by using our Ethics Hotline.

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board adopted a policy addressing our procedures with respect to the review, approval and ratification of related person transactions that are required to be disclosed pursuant to SEC regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that any transaction, arrangement or relationship, or series of similar transactions, to which we are a party, that exceeds $120,000 in the aggregate, with a related person (as defined in the SEC regulations) who has or will have a direct or indirect material interest shall be subject to review, approval or ratification by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its review of related person transactions, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee shall review the material facts and circumstances of the transaction and shall take into account specified factors, where appropriate, based on the particular facts and circumstances, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the nature of the related persons interest in the transaction,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the significance of the transaction to us and to the related person and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) whether the transaction is likely to impair the judgment of the related person to act in the best interest of Frontier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may participate in the review, approval or ratification of a transaction with respect to which he or she is a related person, although such director can be counted for purposes of a quorum and shall provide such information with respect to the transaction as may be reasonably requested by other members of the Committee or the Board.

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of our executive compensation program is to align the goals and interests of our executives with those of Frontier and its stockholders by rewarding our leadership team for delivering on both short-term and long-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our program emphasizes stockholder value creation by using a mix of pay components, the majority of which are at risk and contingent upon performance against specified company and individual goals and tied to annual and sustained performance over a multi-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a year that was both transformational and challenging for Frontier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On April 1, 2016, we completed the acquisition of Verizons wireline properties in California, Texas and Florida for a purchase price of $10.54 billion in cash and assumed debt, which allows us to provide services to residential, commercial and wholesale customers in those areas (the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past three years, and culminating with the close of the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition, we have more than doubled in size and scale, improved the quality of our assets, substantially diversified our revenue streams and geographic footprint and expanded the sophistication and attractiveness of our product offerings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we implemented a new customer-focused organizational structure in December 2016, which is designed to improve the customer experience, streamline processes and reduce costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this new organizational structure, we realigned into two groups: consumer sales and commercial sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows us to better serve the different needs of consumer and business customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-customer facing functions such as finance, human resources, marketing, engineering, information technology and communications that had been regionalized were integrated and centralized to support both segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This eliminated organizational layers, duplicative roles and costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, R. Perley McBride became our Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McBride has more than 20 years of experience in financial roles in the communications industry, including more than a decade at Frontier earlier in his career.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Frontier also faced challenges that negatively impacted revenue and profitability in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our stock price declined significantly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite these challenges, the Compensation Committee and our Board of Directors believe in the future of Frontier as a provider of quality communications services and have utmost confidence in Frontiers management and its ability to rebuild stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier Communications Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee continues to believe that the best way to align the interests of our executives and our stockholders is to reward success when we build stockholder value and limit compensation when stockholder value declines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this approach, due to Frontiers financial performance in 2016, Frontier did not pay annual cash bonuses to any employees, including our NEOs, for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Stockholder Return
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total stockholder return (TSR) is a measure of gains or losses realized by common stockholders over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR combines price appreciation and dividends paid to show the total return to a common stockholder as an annualized percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier had a one year TSR of -20.4% for 2016, which was approximately in the 5  percentile relative to our Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS) industry group, the Integrated Telecommunications Services Group (GICS Code 50101020), and a three year TSR of -7.5%, which was approximately in the 27  percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We paid $493 million in common stock dividends and $214 million in preferred stock dividends in 2016 while continuing to invest in expanding and upgrading our network and product offerings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Features of our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key executive compensation practices are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these practices promote good governance and are in the best interests of Frontier and its stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employ a pay-for-performance executive compensation program whereby approximately 80% of executive compensation is at risk and contingent upon performance against specified company and individual goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay a majority of compensation in the form of long-term incentive awards to defer a portion of pay based on future company performance and tie compensation payout levels to our stock performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use multipliers to reward above-target performance and reduce short-term and long-term incentive payouts for below-target performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require our executives to own Frontier stock equal to a multiple of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our CEO, this multiple is five times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use double-trigger change-in-control severance arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hold an annual stockholder vote on our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Have a recoupment, or clawback, policy to recover both cash and equity compensation from executives, including in the case of misconduct that results in a restatement of our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engage an independent compensation consultant to provide advice to our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Dont Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permit our executives to hedge or pledge Frontier stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward our executives with perquisites or tenure-based benefits, such as retiree medical benefits, in the ordinary course.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay dividends on unearned performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Make tax gross-ups for severance payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the results of the annual stockholder vote on our executive compensation program, in addition to other input from our stockholders, when evaluating and determining compensation policies and the compensation for our CEO and the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 stockholder vote affirmed the Compensation Committees decisions for 2015, with a 93.7% stockholder approval of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this strong stockholder support, the Compensation Committee concluded that no significant revisions were necessary to our executive compensation program in 2016, although the Compensation Committee did implement refinements to the program, discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluate our compensation program and practices on an ongoing basis and implemented the following changes in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Re-aligned performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We revised the company performance measures used to determine the bonus pool under the Frontier Bonus Plan in order to align executive interests with Frontiers business objectives following the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reduced duplicative metrics across equity award types.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We removed the overlap in financial metrics used to grant restricted stock awards and performance share awards, which incentivizes our executives to focus on Frontiers overall financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A key tenet of our compensation philosophy is to link the interests of our executives and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 84% of our CEOs TDC for 2016 performance was at risk, i.e., contingent upon performance against specified company and individual goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the other NEOs as a group, on average, approximately 78% of their TDC for 2016 performance was at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This directly links our executives pay to Frontiers financial performance, execution of strategic initiatives and TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 33 for a description of our compensation components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establish clear alignment between the interests of our executives and those of our stockholders by rewarding performance measured by key financial metrics, strategic objectives and relative TSR and through the use of equity awards, rather than cash, as a significant component of annual compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reinforce our performance culture for our NEOs by making a majority of their compensation at risk, i.e., contingent upon achievement of specified company and individual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hire and retain talented executives by having a compensation program that is competitive in relation to comparable companies based on size, overall complexity and the nature of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensure company goals are fully aligned throughout the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, we establish company-wide goals to achieve Frontiers business plan for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are compensated to the extent they are successful in leading Frontier to achieve these goals for each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Design
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To achieve the objectives described above, our executive compensation program rewards our executives for both annual and ong-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the primary components of executive compensation were: base salary and restricted stock awards and performance share awards under the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of these components, only base salary represents ixed compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the other components is variable based on the performance of both Frontier and the individual executive because they are measured against specific pre-established goals and targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, certain of our NEOs eceived a cash bonus in connection with the closing of the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition and the integration of the acquired assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No annual cash bonuses were awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its February 2016 meeting, the Compensation Committee set maximum individual payouts under our umbrella bonus pool and the Operating Cash Flow performance goal for the year, the achievement of which would permit the funding of

sentences.text: General industry survey data, as described below, was also considered in determining the compensation levels of the NEOs and other executives.

sentences.text: In the case of executives for whom there was no publicly available data or no comparable position at the peer group companies, the results from proprietary general industry executive compensation surveys were analyzed to assess competitiveness.

sentences.text: As an initial step in the consideration of survey data, the survey is size-adjusted based on our annual revenue.

sentences.text: The 2015 survey data used to determine 2016 compensation was size-adjusted to approximately $6.0 billion, which reflected Frontiers estimated size following our acquisition of the wireline properties of AT&T in Connecticut (the AT&T Acquisition).

sentences.text: Similarly, in 2016, the survey data used to determine 2017 compensation was size-adjusted to $10.4 billion to approximate Frontiers 2016 revenue, adjusted as if the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition had closed on January 1, 2016.

sentences.text: The analyses included examining how each executives compensation compared to the results in the surveys for base salary, target bonus, target total annual compensation (consisting of base salary and target bonus), target long term incentives and target TDC (consisting of base salary, target annual bonus opportunity and target long-term incentives).

sentences.text: 2016 Realized Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below supplements the Summary Compensation Table that appears later in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Realized Pay Table shows the compensation actually received by each NEO in 2016, 2015 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realized pay for an NEO for any given year may be greater or less than the compensation reported in the Summary Compensation Table for that year depending on fluctuations in stock prices on the grant and vesting dates, differences in equity grant values from year to year and SEC reporting requirements, as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary difference between the Realized Pay Table and the Summary Compensation Table is the method used to value restricted stock awards and performance share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC rules require that the grant date fair value of all restricted stock awards and performance share awards be reported in the Summary Compensation Table for the year in which they were granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, a significant portion of the total compensation amounts reported in the Summary Compensation Table relates to restricted stock awards and performance shares that have not vested or been earned, for which the value is therefore uncertain and which may end up having no value at all.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast, the Realized Pay Table includes only restricted stock and performance shares that vested during the applicable year and shows the value of those awards as of the applicable vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no assurance that the NEOs will actually realize the value attributed to these awards even in this Realized Pay Table, since the ultimate value of the restricted stock and performance shares will depend on the price of Frontiers common stock when the vested and earned shares are sold by the executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives are subject to periodic stock sale restrictions and our stock ownership guidelines, which also limit their ability to sell Frontier stock received as compensation.

sentences.text: Base Salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for our executives, including our NEOs, are set by the Compensation Committee after consideration of various factors, including individual performance, executive experience and skill set, the ability to attract and retain talented executives and market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are eligible for increases to their base salary if there is a change in responsibility or the individuals base salary is not in line with desired market position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally target the median of our peers when setting base salary, but any increases or decreases are ultimately at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.

sentences.text: Bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the Frontier Bonus Plan to provide cash incentives to executives, including the NEOs, based on the achievement of certain company metrics (Company Performance Goals) and individual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus pool is funded based solely on achievement of Company Performance Goals, and the funded pool is allocated based on achievement of Company Performance Goals and individual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the results of the Company Performance Goals were to represent 60% of the funded bonus, and the results of the individual performance evaluations were to represent 40% of the funded bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An NEOs target bonus opportunity is expressed as a percentage of his or her annual base salary and represents the amount the NEO would receive if performance metrics are achieved at target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, each NEO, other than Mr. McCarthy, had a target bonus opportunity equal to 100% of his or her base salary; Mr. McCarthys target bonus opportunity was 130% of his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential bonus payouts could be from 0% for below-threshold performance, up to a maximum of 156% for outstanding performance, of each NEOs target bonus opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achievement of threshold performance would result in a payout of 70% of the target bonus opportunity, subject to the discretion of the Compensation Committee to award no bonuses even if threshold performance is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ndividual performance goals for 2016 were tailored to each NEOs role and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee determined to revise the Company Performance Goals from those used in prior years in order to align executive nterests with Frontiers business objectives following the California, Texas and Florida Acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company Performance Goals were weighted in relation to their importance to Frontiers overall success (the Weighted Company Performance Goals).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Weighted Company Performance Goals    Weighting to Set Bonus Pool (1) Financial Targets    Revenue, Adjusted EBITDA, Adjusted Free Cash Flow Per Share (equally weighted)       60% (2) Customer Experience Improvements       10% (3) Product Improvements    Product Quality Score Improvements    Video Market Penetration    Expand Broadband Availability    Speed Enhancements       15% (4) Prepare and Develop Future Workforce    Increased Training and Certification    Improve Customer Operations Metrics    Promote and Develop Diverse Workforce       15%         100%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specified financial targets are included in the Weighted Company Performance Goals because Frontier uses these targets to assess the overall financial health and performance of Frontier, to analyze and evaluate strategic and operational decisions and to understand cash flow generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontier Communications Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We include Customer Experience Improvements in the Weighted Company Performance Goals because customer experience drives revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also include various measures of the quality and availability of our products in order to incent management to improve them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, in 2016 we targeted the expansion of our video product into new markets, the capability to deliver broadband to additional households and the delivery of faster speed to existing customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ability to execute on these goals will be important in driving revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because Frontier is committed to attracting, developing and retaining a strong workforce, we also included metrics designed to promote enhanced training and improved customer operations and support diversity initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its February 2017 meeting, the Compensation Committee reviewed Frontiers performance against each of the financial targets for 2016, which was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ($ in millions, except per share amounts)                               Financial Target    Threshold     (approx.     90% of     Target)        Target       Outstanding     (approx.     110%     of Target)       Result       Percentage     of Target     Revenue      $8,585    $9,539     $10,493    $8,896     93.3% Adjusted EBITDA      $3,269    $3,632     $ 3,995    $3,525     97.1% Adjusted Free Cash Flow Per Share      $ 0.69    $ 0.77     $ 0.85    $ 0.79     102.6%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout for performance between levels is determined using linear interpolation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviewed 2016 performance against each of the metrics set for the year and determined the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frontiers customer experience improvements, which were designed to increase value for our customers, were accomplished at 38.7% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Product improvement initiatives, which included the introduction of video services under our Vantage brand into five new markets, the increase in broadband availability and the deployment of speed enhancements, were accomplished at 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We developed a stronger workforce through the enhanced training of technicians, internet help desk representatives and other customer-facing personnel and supported our diversity initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance against our workforce targets was 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After assessing performance under each of the Weighted Company Performance Goals, we apply a 3:1 power ratio for results between the threshold (90%) and maximum (110%), meaning that for each one percent that performance is above or below the target (100%), the bonus increases or decreases by three percentage points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance against the 2016 Weighted Company Performance Goals is summarized in the following table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Weighted Company Performance Goals    2016 Performance (1) Financial Targets (60%)      97.7% (2) Customer Experience Improvements (10%)      38.7% (3) Product Improvements (15%)      100% (4) Prepare and Develop Future Workforce (15%)      100% Total Weighted Company Performance      92.5% Total Weighted Company Performance Percentage with 3:1 Power Ratio       77%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After applying the 3:1 power ratio, the performance percentage is calculated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The funded bonus pool is determined accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance percentage is applied to each participants target bonus award, and each participants actual bonus is equal to 60% of the performance-adjusted target bonus plus an individual performance factor times 40% of the performance-adjusted target bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals can earn 0% to 150% of the individual performance factor, depending on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To determine this factor, the Compensation Committee evaluates each NEOs performance against the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee provides long-term incentives to our employees, including our NEOs, through a combination of restricted stock and performance share awards granted under our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n 2016, the Compensation Committee revised the financial metrics used to make restricted stock awards, which eliminated the overlap with the metrics used to make performance share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change further aligns stockholder and executive interests by incentivizing executive officers to focus on Frontiers overall financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February of each year, the Compensation Committee sets a target dollar value of total equity awards for each NEO for that year to fulfill the purposes described above under Compensation Program Design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination, the Compensation Committee considers peer group information and survey data (see page 31 for additional information), as well as the need to align each NEOs interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee determined that one-third of long-term incentive awards should be in the form of performance shares and two-thirds in the form of restricted stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that this mix is appropriate at this time because it aligns stockholder value and executive interests by linking compensation to long-term performance and stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no minimum guaranteed level of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses restricted stock awards (RSAs) as a component of compensation because RSAs encourage our NEOs to focus attention on decisions that emphasize long-term returns for stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSAs are granted based on performance and vest ratably over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally makes all RSA grants to our executives, including our NEOs, at its regularly scheduled meeting each February, with the exception of awards to eligible new hires, which are awarded as of the date of hire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the restricted stock plan, in order for any RSAs to be granted, the Compensation Committee set a minimum performance threshold of an average of 90% for the three financial targets included in the Weighted Company Performance Goals (Revenue, Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted Free Cash Flow Per Share) under the Bonus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines the dollar value of RSA grants based upon the target set at the beginning of the year, which is then adjusted based on attainment of the Weighted Company Performance Goals and assessment of individual performance at the end of such year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no guarantee that an NEO will receive an RSA grant, meaning that an NEO could receive 0% of his or her target RSA opportunity for below-threshold performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum dollar value of potential RSA grants varies by NEO, with the highest being 169% of the value of such NEOs target RSA opportunity, in cases of outstanding performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assesses Mr. McCarthys individual performance and determines his RSA grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSA grants for the other NEOs are determined by the Compensation Committee, taking into account the recommendations of Mr. McCarthy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Compensation Committee determined that the minimum performance threshold was met for 2015 and assigned each NEO the dollar amounts shown in the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table on page 46.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The dollar amount was then converted to a number of RSAs based on the average of the high and low price of Frontiers common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Roles and Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for approving and overseeing our executive compensation philosophy and programs, as well as determining and approving the compensation for our senior executives, which includes our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, at its February meeting, the Compensation Committee reviews the Company Performance Goals and the individual performance goals for the NEOs and approves the target levels for each of the compensation components that apply to the NEOs for the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that same meeting, the Compensation Committee assesses the performance of our NEOs for he year just ended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to CEO compensation, the Compensation Committee reviews its recommendations with the other independent directors and considers any additional input from them before finalizing its decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its compensation decisions, the Compensation Committee reviews tally sheets setting forth all components of compensation paid to the NEOs for the past five years, along with target compensation for those years, including base salary, bonus, grant date values of RSAs and performance share awards and the value of dividends paid on unvested restricted shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tally sheets also show the executives holdings of unvested RSAs and performance share awards from prior years awards and the current value of those awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses these tally sheets to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) review the total annual compensation of the NEOs over the past five years,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) assess the executive officers compensation against their individual and company performance over that period and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) assure that the Committee has a comprehensive view of our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews on a periodic basis management compensation programs, including any management incentive compensation plans, to determine whether they are appropriate, properly coordinated and achieve their intended purpose(s), and recommends to the Board any modifications or new plans or programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO annually reviews the performance and contributions of our senior executives, including our NEOs, and presents to the Compensation Committee his performance assessments and compensation recommendations, including the proposed award for each component of the executives total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCarthys review consists of an assessment of the executives performance against company-level and individual goals and targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee then conducts a separate review process with respect to these executives and, after making any adjustments, approves the compensation for these executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO has no involvement in setting his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retains an independent executive compensation consultant that provides services solely to the Compensation Committee and not Frontier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2010, the Compensation Committee has engaged Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. to assist the Committee in the development of compensation programs, evaluation of compensation practices and the determination of compensation awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2016 the compensation consultant provided advice and insights on additional compensation matters, including with respect to the peer group, benchmarking of executive compensation levels and director compensation, incentive plan design review and our stock incentive plan, and reviewed this Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the compensation consultants input and advice but reaches its own independent decisions on compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Importantly, the Compensation Committee has sole authority to retain and terminate the compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant provides no other services to Frontier and the Compensation Committee has instituted policies to avoid conflicts of interest raised by the work of the compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to SEC rules, the Compensation Committee is required to consider any conflicts of interest raised by the work of the Compensation Committees compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the relevant factors, the Compensation Committee determined that no conflicts of interest were raised by the work of the compensation consultant in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
